metadata.Title: CVE-2016-3076 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the j2k_encode_entry function in Pillow 2.5.0 through 3.1.1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption) via a crafted Jpeg2000 file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3076` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-imaging - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1
python-pil - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1
python-pil.imagetk - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1
python3-pil - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1
python3-pil.imagetk - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> see if built against openjpeg sbeattie> not built against openjpeg j2k support added to pillow in 2.4.0 release

criterions.comment: pillow package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.1.2-0ubuntu1').
